content.description: Cowboy Junkie is an engaging technical route that offers the Junkie more than just sequential crimping. Be prepared for long reaches, side pull shuffling, a once-removed undercling, a few mini-blocks, and a smattering of slopey rails.
content.location: The route takes the red streak up the center of the Tombstone formation.

content.description:
How this obvious line sat for 25 years is beyond me. I figured Mike or Tony or EFR or SOMEBODY must have looked and decided it was too hard or too chossy or something.

 I was also surprised how much loose sh*t I was able to pry off. At elevation just under 8000 feet i expect better rock quality.

 Climb easy but fun 20 foot dihedral to a ledge. The scary-looking blocks above the ledge seem solid and have been reinforced. You don't really use them anyway.

 Above the ledge, launch into a 35 foot, skin-tearing, faintly overhanging crux with a ton of cool sequences. After that you will hit a pod/bucket, and do a celebration cruise up the last 10 feet of beautiful holds.

 There is a keeper bolt for the belayer just left of dihedral. Could be used for CJunkie also.
content.protection: Stainless steel bolts. Some are 3/8 by 3.75. Some are half inch. Climbtech hooks at anchor.
content.location: Obvious dihedral just right of Cowboy Junkie.

content.description:
The Tombstone is a pretty vertical slab of rock high above Sky Valley. This east-facing wall doesn't get much attention due to it only housing three routes. Be prepared for loose, gravelly feet and suspect flakes if you venture too far left or right of the route lines. 

  The afternoon shade makes for pleasant summer climbing and the views are outstanding.
